title.value: Strong gravitational lensing as a probe of dark matter
title.justification: It is the title provided at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Strong gravitational lensing as a probe of dark matter

extractions.description: This paper explores how strong gravitational lensing can offer critical insights into the physical nature of dark matter. It offers a historical perspective, current status, challenges, and future prospects for using galaxy-scale strong gravitational lensing observations to test different dark matter models. The paper also reviews important methodological advances and discusses how these can help constrain the subgalactic dark matter structure.

type.justification: The paper provides empirical data, observational results, and discusses advancements in data analysis methods for probing dark matter.
type.quote: "In this chapter, we describe how galaxy-scale strong gravitational lensing observations are sensitive to the physical nature of dark matter."

name.justification: The study revolves around astrophysical observations and implications for dark matter.

name.justification: The paper focuses on strong gravitational lensing as a method to probe dark matter.
name.quote: "Strong gravitational lensing provides, therefore, a key test of different dark matter models in a way that is independent of the baryonic content of matter structures on subgalactic scales."

name.justification: The paper is devoted to examining how strong gravitational lensing can be used to constrain and understand the nature of dark matter.
name.quote: "One can mitigate or even remove its effect with observations at wavelengths that are known to originate from an extended region around the source or by monitoring the system for a sufficiently large amount of time."

name.justification: CDM is consistently mentioned throughout the paper as the primary dark matter model being tested.
